snippet: If the presidential campaigns of 2008 were dipping a toe into social media like Facebook and Twitter, their 2012 versions are well into the deep end.
abstract: Campaigns of Pres Obama and Mitt Romney are pursuing online audiences with new intensity; seeking out votes from citizens, particularly younger ones, who may not watch television or read the newspaper but spend plenty of time on the social Web; campaigns want to inject themselves into the conversation on services like Tumblr and Twitter.
lead_paragraph: If the presidential campaigns of 2008 were dipping a toe into social media like Facebook and Twitter, their 2012 versions are well into the deep end.

headline.seo: Campaigns Use Social Media to Lure In Younger Voters
headline.main: Campaigns Use Social Media to Lure Younger Voters
